PRE-MARKET JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: LG Electronics (066570 KS) to release Q9 smartphone this week, Co. may also report prelim. Q4 results today
content:
JAPAN

FamilyMart Uny Holdings (8028 JT)
- Co. raises FY18/19 net profit guidance to JPY 44.0bln from JPY 40.0bln. (Newswires)

Marubeni Group (8002 JT)
- Co. is said to invest in US-based Enlitic. (Newswires)

Sony Corp (6758 JT)
- Co. President is said to be planning to make entertainments assets a priority. (Newswires)

Takeda Pharmaceutical (4502 JT)
- Co. will issue 770mln shares at JPY 7601/Shr related to Shire (SHP/ LN) acquisition. (Newswires)

Travel related
- Japan introduced a JPY 1000 departure tax for every person leaving the country. (Nikkei)


SOUTH KOREA

CJ CheilJedang Corp (097950 KS)
- Co. is reportedly continuing its aggressive expansion in US with the recently announced purchase of frozen food maker Schwan’s. (Nikkei)

Dongbu Steel (016380 KS)
- Co. creditors are said to seek sale of controlling stake. (Newswires)

Hyundai Heavy (009540 KS)
- Co. signs power equipment supply contract valued at CNY 273.6mln. (Newswires)

LG Electronics (066570 KS)
- Co. to release Q9 smartphone this week, Co. may also report prelim. Q4 results today. (Newswires)

Naver (035420 KS)
- Line Plus unit is said to target acquisition of brokerage firm in South Korea. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS)
- Co. is speculated to target smartphone output of below 300mln units this year. (Newswires)
- Smart TVs will launch iTunes movies and TV shows from Spring 2019. (Newswires)

PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN STOCK NEWS: Macquarie Group (MQG AT) private wealth division suffers an adviser exodus
content:
Macquarie (MQG AT)
- Co.’s private wealth division has reportedly taken a hit after more than 20 advisers left amid concerns related to a narrow focus on wealthy clients and new remuneration model. (AFR)

RCR Tomlinson (RCR AT)
- The Environmental Group (EGL AT) entered agreement with RCR Tomlinson administrators to acquire RCR Energy Service assets. (Newswires)

Resolute Mining (RSG AT)
- Co. Q2 gold output 73.7k ounces vs. Prev. 66.0k ounces Y/Y. (Newswires)

Yancoal (YAL AT)
- Co. has reportedly moved a step closer to regaining control of 3 Hunter Valley coal mines. (The Australian)

Basic Materials & Energy
- LME Copper rallied by over 3% and WTI crude futures rose 2.6% to above USD 48.00/bbl. (Newswires)

subject: ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Japanese Monetary Base, Nikkei Services and Composite PMI data
US President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are reportedly mulling a potential summit in H1 2019 according to sources, if progress is made in trade talks which begin today in Beijing
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

PBoC announced a cut to RRR by 100bps in which a 50bps reduction will take effect as of Jan 15th and then a further 50bps on Jan 25th. (Newswires)

Australian AIG Performance of Manufacturing Index (Dec) 49.5 (Prev. 51.3). (Newswires)
 

UK/EU

MPs reportedly believe that Parliamentary rules will prevent UK PM May bulldozing her Brexit deal through by staging multiple repeat votes until the Commons surrenders. (Independent)

COMMODITIES

US EIA Weekly Crude Stocks w/e 0.007M vs. Exp. -3.086M (Prev. -0.046M). (Newswires)

Baker Hughes Rig Count (4/Jan): Oil down 8 at 877, NatGas unchanged at 198; total down 4 at 1075. (Newswires)
 

US

US President Trump said he thinks US will make a deal with China and that China economic weakness has put US in a strong position in trade talks. US President Trump also said he is willing for government shutdown to go on for months or years but doesn't think it will and hopes can reopen in a few days. (Newswires)

US President Trump tweeted that V.P. Mike Pence and group had a productive meeting with the Schumer/Pelosi representatives today. Many details of Border Security were discussed. We are now planning a Steel Barrier rather than concrete. It is both stronger & less obtrusive. Good solution, and made in the U.S.A. (Twitter)

Fed Chair Powell said that Fed policy is not on a preset path, while Powell also commented that the Fed will be patient in watching data and are prepared to adjust policy stance. (Newswires)

Fed's Barkin (non-voter) said economy will grow more slowly in 2019 than in 2018, while there were separate comments from Fed's Bostic (voter, dovish) who defended central bank's approach to winding down the balance sheet and stated that policy path is not "set in stone" and can be adjusted for the unexpected. (Newswires)

US Non-Farm Payrolls Dec 312k vs. Exp. 177.0k (Prev. 155.0k, Rev. 176k); two-month net revisions +58k. (Newswires)
US Unemployment Rate Dec 3.9% vs. Exp. 3.7% (Prev. 3.7%)
US Average Earnings YY Dec 3.2% vs. Exp. 3.0% (Prev. 3.1%)


MARKET RECAP

Trade sensitive semiconductors (AMD, NVDA, INTC) and other stocks (CAT, BA, MMM) pushed indices higher today. Netflix (NFLX) outperformed with thanks to an upgrade at Goldman. Apple (AAPL) pared back some of yesterday’s selloff, supported by Citi reiterating its buy rating. GameStop (GME) opened higher after buyout firms showed bidding interest. Celgene (CELG) continued its upward trajectory from yesterday as the market digests Bristol-Myers (BMY) acquiring it. Mosaic (MOS) was another outperformer on the back of it gaining a final permit for a new phosphate mine project. Utilities was the underperforming sector as investors moved out of defensive stocks. SPX +3.4% at 2532, NDX +4.5% at 6423, DJI +3.3% at 23430.

Yields rose by between 7.5bps and 12bps across the curve on Friday, underpinned by a blockbuster payrolls report as well as dovish comments by Fed chair Powell. Most of the action was in the belly of the curve, which helped 2s5s widen by around 2bps on the session, leaving it around 0.5bps away from unwinding its inversion. However, other major curve spreads were tighter, notably the 5s30s part of the curve, which came in by over 5bps. US T-note futures (H19) settled 27+ ticks lower at 122-09+.
